intro.title: 1. Introduction
intro.content: At {companyName} ({tradeName}), with company registration number {taxId} and registered address at {address}, we are committed to protecting the privacy of our users. This Privacy Policy describes how we collect, use and protect your personal information in accordance with the UK General Data Protection Regulation (UK GDPR) and the Data Protection Act 2018.

dataController.title: 2. Data Controller
dataController.content: The data controller responsible for your personal data is:

dataCollected.title: 3. Data We Collect
dataCollected.content: We collect the following types of personal data:
dataCollected.identification: Identification data: name, company number, VAT number
dataCollected.contact: Contact data: address, telephone, email address
dataCollected.professional: Professional data: information about pianos and services performed
dataCollected.financial: Financial data: invoicing and payment information
dataCollected.technical: Technical data: IP address, device type, browser

purposes.title: 4. Purposes of Processing
purposes.content: We process your personal data for the following purposes:
purposes.serviceManagement: Management of piano maintenance and repair services

legalBasis.title: 5. Legal Basis for Processing
legalBasis.content: The processing of your data is based on:
legalBasis.contract: Performance of a contract or pre-contractual measures

dataRetention.title: 6. Data Retention
dataRetention.content: We will retain your personal data for as long as necessary to fulfil the purposes described and, subsequently, for the legally required periods. Invoicing data will be retained for the legal period of 6 years in accordance with HMRC requirements.

dataSharing.title: 7. Data Sharing
dataSharing.content: Your data may be shared with:
dataSharing.taxAuthorities: HM Revenue & Customs for compliance with tax obligations
dataSharing.mtd: Making Tax Digital system for digital record keeping and VAT returns

internationalTransfers.title: 8. International Transfers
internationalTransfers.content: Some of our service providers may be located outside the United Kingdom. In these cases, we ensure that appropriate safeguards are in place in accordance with UK GDPR, such as standard contractual clauses approved by the Information Commissioner's Office.

rights.title: 9. Your Rights
rights.content: You have the following rights regarding your personal data:
rights.access: Right of access: to know what data we process about you
rights.rectification: Right to rectification: to correct inaccurate data
rights.erasure: Right to erasure: to request deletion of your data
rights.restriction: Right to restriction: to restrict processing in certain cases
rights.portability: Right to data portability: to receive your data in a structured format
rights.objection: Right to object: to object to the processing of your data
rights.withdraw: Right to withdraw consent at any time
rights.howToExercise: To exercise these rights, you can contact us at {email} or through the Privacy section of the application.

security.title: 10. Security Measures
security.content: We implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to protect your personal data against unauthorised access, alteration, disclosure or destruction. These measures include data encryption, access control and regular backups.

cookies.title: 11. Cookie Policy
cookies.content: This application may use cookies and similar technologies to improve your experience. You can manage your cookie preferences from the Settings section.

changes.title: 12. Changes to this Policy
changes.content: We reserve the right to modify this Privacy Policy at any time. We will notify you of any significant changes through the application or by email.

contact.title: 13. Contact
contact.content: For any queries relating to this Privacy Policy or the processing of your personal data, you can contact us at:
contact.supervisoryAuthority: You may also lodge a complaint with the Information Commissioner's Office (ico.org.uk) if you believe your rights have been infringed.

invoicing.content: The Application enables the generation of digital invoices in compliance with UK regulations. Invoices generated comply with Making Tax Digital (MTD) requirements from HM Revenue & Customs. The user is responsible for the accuracy of the data included in invoices.

liability.title: 8. Limitation of Liability
liability.dataLoss: Loss of data due to technical failures

warranties.content: The Application is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind, express or implied. We do not warrant that the Application will be uninterrupted, error-free or that it will meet your specific expectations.

termination.content: We may suspend or terminate your access to the Application at any time if you breach these Terms. You may stop using the Application at any time by deleting your account.

modifications.title: 11. Modifications
modifications.content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. Changes will be effective from their publication in the Application. Continued use of the Application after the publication of changes constitutes your acceptance of them.

governing.title: 12. Governing Law and Jurisdiction
governing.content: These Terms are governed by the laws of England and Wales. For any dispute arising from these Terms, the parties submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales.

contact.title: 13. Contact
contact.content: For any queries about these Terms, you can contact us at {email}.
